intro: Commiphora samharensis, commonly known as the Samharen myrrh tree, is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the Burseraceae family, which includes frankincense and myrrh-producing species. The plant is characterized by its aromatic resinous exudate, which has been historically used in traditional medicine and incense. Its leaves are typically alternate, simple, and have a leathery texture. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and coastal areas.
